newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Volvo unit, Emery seal air cargo deal.
newsitem.headline: Volvo unit, Emery seal air cargo deal.

text.p: Emery Worldwide, a subsidiary of U.S. based CNF Transportation Inc., won a contract from Volvo Construction Equipment (VCE) totalling 4,000 to 5,000 kg daily air freight from Sweden to the U.S., VCE said on Thursday.

VCE, the construction machinery and equipment subsidiary of Swedish vehicle maker AB Volvo, said in a statement it would begin sending shipments of spare parts for construction vehicles and equipment to its Chicago warehouse by air instead of sea.
VCE's spare parts distribution centre is based in Enskilstuna, Sweden, which is 120 km west of Stockholm.
"The stock order to fill up the U.S. warehouse has been shipped by ocean for many years," VCE transportation spokesman Goerdt Schlickum told Reuters.
"We have decided to move the stock order...by air and now we have 72 hour service," he said.

Demand for VCE spares within North America has risen 25 percent in the past three years, VCE said. VCE keeps over 130,000 different parts in stock with which it serves a network of over 200 dealers in the U.S. and its own sales operations.
